Investors are advised to deploy capital systematically, with large caps being the preferred segment.

In contrast, gold prices continued their downward trend for the second consecutive day. Spot silver saw a significant increase in international markets, boosting the white metal's performance locally.

items.title: Analysts see better risk-reward in 2026 even as near-term headwinds persist
items.summary: Indian equities begin 2026 with cautious optimism, despite liquidity concerns and global uncertainties.  Market participants anticipate a better risk-reward balance, with reasonable valuations and projected index gains.  Sustained returns will depend on a strong earnings rebound in FY27, following a subdued FY26.  Experts suggest staggered investment and diversified equity allocations.

items.title: S Korea stocks crush global benchmarks with best stock rally since 1999
items.summary: South Korea's stock market saw a remarkable surge in 2025. The Kospi Index recorded its best performance in 25 years. Strong gains were seen in arms exporters, AI, and K-beauty sectors. Chip giants like Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix contributed significantly. Analysts predict further growth for the market.

items.summary: Copper recorded the longest winning run since 2017 in a December rally powered by the prospect of more stress in the supply chain.

items.title: Oil Heads for Deepest Annual Loss Since 2020 on Surplus Concerns
items.summary: Oil headed for its deepest annual loss since the pandemic in 2020, with prices undermined by concerns about a punishing surplus that’s set to dominate market sentiment and trading into the new year.

items.title: AI memory demand propels Kioxia to world’s best-performing stock
items.summary: Japanese memory chipmaker Kioxia Holdings Corp has seen its stock surge by an astonishing 540% this year, becoming the top performer on Japan's Topix index. This remarkable gain is fueled by the insatiable demand for data storage driven by the AI boom, with Kioxia's NAND flash memory chips being crucial for AI training and data centers.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Economists urge tax incentives, data centre push and export diversification at PM Modi’s pre-Budget meet
items.summary: Budget 2026: Experts urged tax incentives for household savings and support for data centres, AI, and robotics. They called for diversifying services exports and using trade agreements for market access. Concerns about critical mineral access led to suggestions for a coordinated strategy. Fiscal consolidation was also discussed.

items.title: Top Exporters? All loads lead to India’s hotspots
items.summary: India's export success is concentrated in a few key districts and states. Gujarat, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, and Uttar Pradesh are leading merchandise exports. Jamnagar in Gujarat and Kanchipuram in Tamil Nadu are top exporting districts. Uttar Pradesh is emerging as an electronics manufacturing hub. Location advantages and policy support are crucial for this growth.

items.title: Zoomer at the centre of entertainment’s next major act
items.summary: Gen Z is reshaping content, commerce, and creativity by demanding interactive, creator-led ecosystems and micro-payment models. Their preference for gaming, short-form storytelling, and blending of formats drives platforms to innovate. This generation actively participates, creates, and monetizes, transforming content into a dynamic social and commercial loop.

items.title: This Gen sets eyes on a green future
items.summary: India's Gen Z, shaped by economic growth and digital access, approaches environmental issues with a solution-oriented mindset.  With parental economic security and a focus on capital markets, they prioritize sustainability, viewing environmental impacts as problems to solve. This generation sees climate and environment not just as concerns but as career opportunities, driving a surge in green job demand across India.

items.title: Swipe, save, invest: Banking on the move, the Zoomer way
items.summary: Gen Z is redefining banking, prioritizing mobile apps and UPI for all financial needs over traditional branches. Banks are adapting, with a significant portion of new digital customers being Gen Z, who seek speed, simplicity, and seamless experiences. This digital-first mindset is also influencing insurance, with a demand for instant, controllable products.

items.title: Run, rave, repeat! Wellness turns social for Gen Z
items.summary: Gen Z embraces wellness through social activities like pickleball and dance workouts. Brands are set to sponsor these events in 2026.  Physical wellness is now a social identity.  Gen Z is also choosing low and no-alcohol drinks.  This zero-proof trend will continue.  Non-alcoholic cocktails are emerging for social settings.

items.title: No weight & watch approach in Gen Z’s main weightloss plan
items.summary: Young adults in their early 20s are increasingly seeking weight-loss drugs like Mounjaro for cosmetic reasons, despite not meeting medical criteria. Doctors report a rise in demand from Gen Z, with many practitioners prescribing these medications indiscriminately, even when diet and exercise would suffice.

items.title: New Year strike fears push brands to stock up as delivery workers plan walkout
items.summary: As delivery gig workers plan a New Year's Eve strike over pay and safety, packaged goods companies are increasing stock in kirana stores and supermarkets. Restaurant chains are promoting their own apps and partnering with unaffected logistics providers to mitigate potential delivery disruptions.

items.title: Matcha isn’t just a trend, it’s a vibe for Gen Zoomers
items.summary: Matcha has evolved from a Gen Z treat to a full-blown identity, appealing to their desire for calm, quiet energy, and aesthetic appeal. This trend is reshaping the F&B landscape, with brands like Starbucks and Got Tea adapting to cater to Gen Z's demand for personalized, visually engaging, and lifestyle-driven experiences.

items.title: Lost in translation: Bollywood struggles to speak Gen Z lingo
items.summary: Bollywood is struggling to connect with Gen Z, who seek authentic, fresh storytelling over formulaic narratives. While this demographic enjoys diverse genres and theatrical experiences, mainstream Hindi cinema's current offerings often fail to resonate. Makers must adapt marketing and creative strategies to capture their attention.

items.title: India’s next big consumer force is here to stay: Why cracking the Gen Z code will shape the next decade
items.summary: Nestle India's new MD Manish Tiwary is prioritizing Gen Z's demand for quality and health-conscious products, a trend highlighted by his son. This demographic, aged 14-29, is significantly reshaping India's consumer landscape, driving spending and forcing brands across all sectors to adapt their strategies and offerings to remain relevant.

items.title: Gen Zoomers take the road less travelled
items.summary: Gen Z is significantly influencing the travel industry, making up almost 40% of global travelers. This tech-savvy, eco-conscious generation prioritizes experiences, leading to innovations like bar check-ins and all-day breakfasts. They are driving demand for spontaneous, short-haul trips and immersive long-haul journeys, with a growing interest in spiritual travel.

items.title: Gen Zoomers and their ever-growing love for mutual funds
items.summary: Fintech platforms are increasingly attracting new mutual fund investors, particularly Gen Z, who are registering a significant number of new Systematic Investment Plans. This younger demographic, preferring equity-oriented products and a do-it-yourself approach, is driving a structural shift in investment behavior and entering the market at an earlier age.

items.title: Gen Zoomers and their ever-growing love for mutual funds
items.summary: Fintech platforms are attracting new investors to mutual funds. Gen Z individuals are increasingly investing in equity-oriented mutual funds. They prefer a do-it-yourself approach to investing. This trend indicates a significant shift in how younger generations are saving and investing their money in India.

items.title: Gen Z's art era: How the new generation is reshaping the art market online
items.summary: Gen Z is revolutionizing the art market by embracing it as a lifestyle, prioritizing flexibility, transparency, and ethical relevance. They are driving the rise of young contemporary artists and regional voices, often starting with accessible price points and fractional ownership. The art world is adapting by leveraging social media and offering more approachable collecting experiences to engage this demographic.

items.title: Gen Z stands at the heart of India’s big manufacturing pivot
items.summary: India's electronics and semiconductor manufacturing growth is poised to be driven by GenZ. This digital-native generation brings technical fluency and an appetite for innovation, transforming the sector from assembly to invention. Industry leaders believe GenZ's comfort with advanced tools and their questioning nature will propel India to become a global hub for high-value manufacturing and chip design.

items.title: From clubbing to kirtan, Gen Z find a new groove in bhajan raves
items.summary: Gen Z is embracing a new nightlife trend, opting for bhajan-led community gatherings and kirtan EDM over traditional clubbing. This sober social movement is gaining significant traction, with ticketed devotional nights selling out and searches for related terms skyrocketing. Organizers anticipate this spiritual-social format to become mainstream by 2026.

items.title: Adani calls for more flying rights, eyes more traffic at its airports
items.summary: Adani Group wants more international flights at its airports. This plan conflicts with Air India and IndiGo. These airlines worry about competition from foreign carriers. Adani Group is investing heavily in airport upgrades. They believe more flights will make Indian airports global hubs. The government's current policy limits foreign airline capacity. This situation impacts ticket prices and airport development.

items.title: Warner Bros set to reject Paramount takeover bid again
items.summary: The board is waiting for Paramount to improve financial terms after previously dismissing its $30-a-share cash bid as inferior to Netflix’s acquisition deal for Warner Bros.’ studio and streaming businesses

items.summary: The move is aimed at promoting value-added agricultural exports while ensuring compliance with international organic certification requirements.

items.summary: Rejecting the claims, the Adani Group-owned airport said RoW was never denied, accused telcos of cartelisation, and said it has installed neutral-host IBS, offered industry-standard rates and provided free high-speed Wi-Fi.

items.summary: The fund focuses on profitable mid to late-stage companies across BFSI, consumer and business services sectors.

items.summary: Growth has been driven largely by robust private consumption and strong domestic demand.

items.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. plans to once again reject a takeover bid from Paramount Skydance Corp. after the rival media company amended the terms of its offer, according to people familiar with the company’s thinking.

items.title: Insurance penetration remained unchanged in 2025, at about half of global average
items.summary: Indian insurance penetration stays at 3.7 percent, lagging behind the global average. Life insurance penetration saw a slight dip, while non-life insurance remained steady. Insurance density, however, increased to 97 dollars per person. Experts predict a period of adjustment for the sector due to new regulations. Life insurance premiums are expected to grow moderately before a stronger recovery.

Life insurance premiums are expected to grow moderately before a stronger recovery.

items.title: Insurance premiums rose in 2025, so did costs
items.summary: Indian insurance sector saw steady premium growth in FY25. Life insurers reported improved profits, with total profit after tax rising significantly. However, rising distribution costs and breaches of expense limits remained a concern for both life and non-life segments. Health and motor insurance drove growth in the non-life sector. Commission payouts continued to be a large expense.

items.summary: The insurance sector is preparing for shifts in how distributors are paid. New rules empower the regulator to set limits on commissions. Insurers are discussing changes to sales incentives and commission structures. These adjustments aim for better policyholder benefits and reduced complaints. The transition is expected to impact existing sales models. Industry bodies are deliberating on new compensation plans.

items.summary: RBL Bank's Executive Director Rajeev Ahuja retires on February 21. Jaideep Iyer will take over as Executive Director from February 21 for a three-year term, pending shareholder approval. Deepak Ruiya is appointed interim Chief Financial Officer. Pushpendra Sharma, head of digital banking, has resigned. The bank has leadership depth to manage responsibilities.

items.summary: Octopus Energy Group Ltd. swung to a full-year loss after reporting a slump in gas consumption and one-time costs from its acquisition of Bulb Energy Ltd.

items.title: India imposes three-year tariff on some steel products to curb cheap imports
items.summary: The measure, which was published on the official government gazette, excludes imports from certain developing countries, though China, Vietnam, and Nepal will be subject to the levy. It also will not apply to specialty steel products such as stainless steel.

items.title: Centre rolls out spectrum plan for 5G, 6G networks
items.summary: India's new spectrum plan earmarks 700MHz in the 6GHz band for advanced mobile networks. This forward-looking blueprint also allocates crucial bands for satellite services. Additional spectrum is designated for in-flight and maritime connectivity. Emerging technologies like vehicle-to-everything communication will also benefit. This policy ensures India is ready for future technological advancements in telecommunications.

items.title: Property prices may stabilize in 2026
items.summary: Gurugram property prices surged 150% since 2019. Other cities like Pune and Noida also saw significant growth. While transaction volumes dipped in 2025, sales value rose due to larger deal sizes. Wealthy buyers drove luxury housing demand. Affordability is set to improve for mid-income buyers in 2026, leading to broader growth.

items.title: Regulatory delays cripple Indian cos: Certifications disrupt FMCG, electronics sectors' performance
items.summary: Businesses face significant delays due to slow regulatory approvals like BIS quality certifications and FSSAI licenses. This impacts production schedules, imports, and product launches.  Companies report months of delays, missing crucial festive and peak sales periods.  Sectors like electronics, telecom, FMCG, and consumer goods are most affected.  Regulatory preparedness is key to business success in India.

items.title: Chamoli train accident: Two trains carrying rail workers collide inside Uttarakhand tunnel, around 50 injured
items.summary: Chamoli Loco Train Accident: A major accident occurred in Chamoli, Uttarakhand. Two loco trains collided inside a tunnel. Around 50 workers sustained injuries. Some workers are in serious condition. Relief and rescue operations are underway. Injured workers are receiving treatment at Gopeshwar district hospital. A detailed inquiry has been ordered.

items.title: India is now fourth largest economy, says govt.
items.summary: The government says that with the GDP valued at $4.18 trillion, “India has surpassed Japan to become the world’s fourth largest economy”, it says that the country is “poised to displace Germany from the third rank” with a projected GDP of $7.3 trillion by 2030

items.title: Finmin weighs plans for faster case disposals at debt recovery tribunals
items.summary: The Finance Ministry met with debt recovery tribunal officials and bank representatives. Discussions focused on improving bank oversight and debt recovery. The aim is to speed up case disposal and increase recoveries. Reforms to existing laws were considered. Training for tribunal staff and bank officers was also on the agenda. Best practices from high-performing tribunals will be adopted.

items.title: India beats Japan to become world's 4th largest economy
items.summary: India has now become the world's fourth-largest economy, surpassing Japan. Projections indicate India will overtake Germany to become the third-largest economy by 2030. This growth is driven by strong domestic consumption. India is the fastest-growing major economy globally and is expected to maintain this momentum.

items.title: Macquarie to Inject £245 Million More Into UK’s Southern Water
items.summary: Macquarie Asset Management committed to putting a further £245 million ($330 million) of equity into Southern Water Ltd. as part of a plan to strengthen the finances of the UK utility.

items.title: Organic sugar exports up to 50,000 tonnes annually allowed: DGFT
items.summary: India has eased its export policy for organic sugar, permitting shipments of up to 50,000 tonnes annually. This move lifts the "restricted" status imposed in 2023, which had mandated traders to secure licenses for exports. The Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) announced the revised policy, outlining specific modalities for these exports.

items.title: Select PSB digital playbooks picked for broader adoption
items.summary: Government is promoting collaboration among state-run banks. Select digital initiatives from Canara Bank, Bank of Maharashtra, and State Bank of India are being identified for wider adoption. These include geospatial analytics for business development, digital co-lending systems, and comprehensive digital transformation frameworks. Banks will evaluate and adapt these proven solutions to their specific needs.

items.title: European Stocks Gain With Focus on Fed Minutes, Ukraine Talks
items.summary: European stocks edged higher on Tuesday as investors awaited the minutes of the Federal Reserve’s last meeting, while focus remained on Ukraine peace negotiations.

items.title: 17km/day: Highways construction slows down to decadal low
items.summary: National highway construction has hit a decade low, with daily road building dropping to 17.06 km this fiscal year. Despite this slowdown, the government is focusing on asset monetisation, raising ₹1.52 lakh crore by November 2025, and aims to revive private investment through a significant PPP pipeline.

items.title: Funds use in slow lane, MoRTH budget allocation likely to see meagre hike

Gautam Adani also saw his fortune grow by $5.9 billion following a clean chit from Sebi. Conversely, Shiv Nadar and Azim Premji experienced wealth declines amid IT stock downturns.

items.title: Rupee rises 3 paise to 89.95 against U.S. dollar in early trade
items.summary: At the interbank foreign exchange, the rupee opened at 89.98 against the US dollar before rising to 89.95, up 3 paise from its previous close

items.title: Warren Buffett retires tomorrow. Can Berkshire Hathaway thrive without the Oracle of Omaha?
items.summary: Warren Buffett is retiring as Berkshire Hathaway CEO on December 31. Gregory Abel will take over operational control. This marks the end of a significant chapter for the company. Investors are now considering Berkshire's future direction. Buffett will remain chairman. The company's vast holdings and investment strategy will be closely watched.

items.title: Hindustan Copper doubled money in 2025 after 40% rally in 8 days. Too late to buy now?
items.summary: Hindustan Copper shares surged nearly 40% in eight sessions, crossing 100% gains for 2025, driven by global supply disruptions and surging demand from electrification and AI. Favorable macro trends, including a weak dollar and rising copper prices, further boosted the company's outlook. Experts suggest a strong medium-term outlook, though near-term caution is advised due to elevated RSI levels.

items.title: Gujarat Kidney shares list at 6% premium over IPO price
items.summary: Gujarat Kidney and Super Speciality debuted on stock exchanges with a 6% premium, opening at Rs 120.75 on BSE and Rs 120 on NSE, against its IPO price of Rs 114. The Rs 251 crore IPO saw healthy investor participation, driven by strong retail demand, despite muted grey market signals.

items.title: Waaree Energies appoints Jignesh Rathod as CEO-designate after Amit Paithankar resigns
items.summary: The company said its board has accepted his resignation and approved the appointment of Jignesh Rathod as the next CEO

items.title: The year of the antifragile: India’s 2025 performance signals structural strength heading into 2026
items.summary: India's economy and markets displayed remarkable antifragility in 2025, not just enduring shocks but strengthening from them. Domestic investors stepped in decisively as global uncertainty and trade tariffs briefly unsettled markets. The India-UK FTA and a robust IPO market highlight India's growing global role and investor confidence, with participation expanding beyond major cities.

items.title: India’s petrochemical consumption to grow 6-7% annually, says CareEdge
items.summary: To reduce import dependence, domestic players are planning aggressive capacity expansions, with polypropylene capacity expected to rise 1.8 times by FY30, surpassing demand growth.

items.title: Indian-origin Stanford graduate built $600 million company; has an ‘alegbra’ advice to succeed in life
items.summary: Shubham Goel, a student of DPS RK Puram in New Delhi, got accepted into Stanford University in 2013, according to his LinkedIn profile. He graduated early to build Affinity.

items.title: Smallcap multibagger stock with 360% returns in a year goes ex-date for 3:1 bonus issue. Do you own?
items.summary: A-1 Ltd, a smallcap stock with stellar returns, is offering a 3:1 bonus share issue. Investors must buy shares by December 30, 2025, to qualify. Following this, a 1:10 stock split will occur. These corporate actions aim to boost share count and liquidity for shareholders.

items.title: In a photo finish, metals' superiority over PSU banks is a 2025 takeaway. Here's how
items.summary: Metal stocks are set for a photo finish with PSU banks in 2025, but metals show broader strength with 93% generating positive returns versus 67% for PSU banks. Hindustan Copper leads with a 90% surge, while Canara Bank tops PSU banks with a 50% gain. Metal sector outlook remains positive.

items.title: Reliance Jio's defining act: What the 2026 IPO means for RIL shareholders after Rs 4.5 lakh crore rally
items.summary: Reliance Industries shareholders anticipate the much-awaited Jio IPO in H1 2026, potentially India's largest listing, aiming to unlock significant value. After a substantial rally driven by telecom, retail, and refining, the IPO could further boost RIL's market capitalization, though a holding company discount remains a consideration.

items.title: Sensex falls over 200 pts, Nifty below 25,900 as foreign flow woes linger
items.summary: Indian stock markets began Tuesday on a down note. The Sensex and Nifty continued their recent decline. Investors remained cautious. This was due to quiet year-end trading. Concerns about foreign fund flows also kept markets subdued. Trading volumes were thin. Risk appetite was limited.

items.title: Two currency bets in Asia flash warning signs as year-end nears
items.summary: The moves underscore a volatile end to a year in which the region’s currencies have been at the forefront of tariff-related trade disruptions and central bank surprises

These picks are based on strong earnings visibility and favorable risk-reward. Investors can look at names like Bharti Airtel, SBI, HCL Tech, and TVS Motors for potential growth over the next two to three years.

items.title: Dixon Technologies among 5 F&O stocks that saw a sharp rise in futures open Interest

items.title: Japan's Nikkei gauge trims 2025 surge as techs take a breather
items.summary: Japan's Nikkei index saw a slight dip on Tuesday, with tech stocks leading the decline. Despite this, the Nikkei is on track for a significant annual gain, its third consecutive. SoftBank's acquisition news and a broader tech pullback from Wall Street contributed to the day's movements, though analysts suggest end-of-year adjustments are a key factor.

items.title: Motilal Oswal picks 4 defence stocks with upside potential of up to 36% after DAC’s Rs 79,000 cr clearance

The brokerage sees Bharat Electronics, Hindustan Aeronautics, Bharat Dynamics and Astra Microwave Products benefiting from a strong defence procurement pipeline over the medium term.

items.title: 2026 is a year of milestones. Do big numbers mean better lives for the average Indian?
items.summary: The year 2025 saw key public reforms, but India faced many tests along the way. In 2026, the country will mark global GDP milestones, but once the dust settles, we will have to contend with the biting reality: the economy's roar isn't reaching every door, yet.

items.title: Investing in 2026: It is no different from the years gone by—but here’s advice for the New Year
items.summary: This is a good time for investors to revisit their portfolios to see if they align with their goals. Dismiss the usual forecasts, keep investing in gloomy times as a contra bet within one's allocation limits and get rid of losing bets. If the goal is to maximize wealth, make clinical decisions.

A close above VWAP indicates prices strengthened through the session, often viewed as a short-term bullish signal reflecting active buying interest and potential continuation of upward momentum.

This strategic move bolsters Lupin's diabetes and obesity treatment portfolio, offering a convenient and effective option for patients amidst a growing metabolic health challenge in India.

items.title: India's domination of global rice trade stokes looming water crisis
items.summary: India's booming rice exports are depleting groundwater in key agricultural states, forcing farmers to drill deeper borewells at increasing costs. Government subsidies for water-intensive rice cultivation discourage shifts to less thirsty crops, despite fledgling state efforts to promote alternatives like millets. This unsustainable practice has global implications due to India's significant role in the world rice market.

items.title: Save India’s Aravalli range: Let’s hope the precautionary principle prevails at the Supreme Court
items.summary: A radical redefinition of this range of hills, as proposed, could ruin both its ecology and ability to shield India’s capital. As the Supreme Court examines the issue again, there’s a clear case for high caution to be exercised—even if greater exposure to mining is deemed a must.

Falling for the fifth consecutive day, the 30-share BSE Sensex dipped 20.46 points or 0.02% to settle at 84,675.08. Ending the day on a flat note, the 50-share NSE Nifty slipped 3.25 points or 0.01% to 25,938.85. From the 30-Sensex firms, Eternal, Infosys, Asian Paints, UltraTech Cement, Bajaj Finance, HCL Tech and Titan were among the biggest laggards. However, Tata Steel, Ma

items.title: Regulator PNGRB for regulating regasification fee, bringing natural gas under GST
items.summary: The proposal comes days after the regulator lowered the tariff slabs for gas transportation, thereby making compressed natural gas and city gas distribution prices cheaper.

items.title: RBI cracked the whip on banks in 2025—just not as hard
items.summary: The regulator initially sends a show cause notice to the entity concerned; if it is not satisfied by the response, a penalty follows. The fine also sends a message to the bank's board.

items.title: From road to rail: Unpacking India's transport strategy to meet national climate commitment
items.summary: As countries struggle to meet NDC commitments amid rising global temperatures, the transport sector is key.

items.title: In green mobility, India turns focus to where it matters—electric buses, trucks
items.summary: Overall adoption of EVs rose in India despite supply-chain disruptions in 2025, stemming from China’s grip in rare earths. But, the government is focusing on electric buses and trucks, which are crucial for India to meet its 30% electric transport target by 2030.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Centre’s dividend kitty may beat budget estimates in FY26
items.summary: India Budget: Government dividend collections from public sector enterprises are poised to exceed targets for a fifth consecutive year, potentially reaching a new high in 2025-26. Despite strong performance and robust inflows, the Centre will likely maintain its initial Rs 69,000 crore dividend projection due to global and domestic uncertainties. This consistent dividend strength has helped offset weaker disinvestment receipts.

items.title: Going full steam: India's industrial output scales 2-year peak, rises 6.7% in Nov
items.summary: India's industrial output saw a significant surge in November, reaching a 25-month high of 6.7% driven by a robust manufacturing rebound. This revival, attributed partly to GST rationalization and festive demand, saw 20 out of 23 industry groups posting growth. While economists see positive signs for consumption, they caution about temporary factors and potential trade barrier impacts.

items.title: Strongly positioned, country must shield against looming risks: RBI
items.summary: The RBI reports a positive near-term economic outlook with low inflation, but warns of global uncertainties and rising cyber-enabled frauds. The banking sector remains resilient with strong buffers and improving asset quality, though concerns exist regarding climate risk and misselling of financial products.

items.title: Gujarat tops in okra production
items.summary: In 2024–25, okra cultivation expanded across 12 districts of Saurashtra and Kutch, covering around 14,000 hectares and yielding close to 1.5 lakh tonnes

items.title: Govt eases norms, halves approval time to fast-track setting up of ITIs
items.summary: The government is speeding up the process for setting up Industrial Training Institutes. Industry players can now establish new institutes or take over existing ones more easily. Approval times have been cut by half, and entry requirements are now simpler. This move aims to significantly increase skilling opportunities across India.

items.title: India, Bahrain exchange draft terms to begin trade pact talks
items.summary: India and Bahrain are moving forward with trade talks. Draft terms for a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement have been exchanged. A joint working group is being established. India is also in discussions with the GCC for a free trade pact, with terms for Qatar substantially finalized. These agreements aim to boost Indian exports and diversify trade routes.

items.title: States to gain Rs 17,000 crore under VB-G RAM G scheme: SBI report
items.summary: A State Bank of India report indicates states will be net gainers of approximately ₹17,000 crore under the new rural employment law, the VB-G RAM G Act, replacing MGNREGA. The new legislation shifts to a normative funding model, with most states projected to benefit, except for Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh which may see minimal losses.

items.title: PM Modi to meet economists, sector experts for inputs ahead of Union Budget
items.summary: Union Budget, 2026: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will meet economists and sectoral experts on Tuesday. They will discuss suggestions for the upcoming Union Budget. The focus will be on achieving Atmanirbharta and transforming India into a Viksit Bharat by 2047. Discussions will cover boosting exports, generating employment, attracting investments, and enhancing skill development. The Union Budget for 2026-27 is expected on February 1.

items.title: Australia to scrap tariffs on all Indian exports from January 1, 2026: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Australia will eliminate tariffs on all Indian exports starting January 1, 2026, a move expected to boost labor-intensive sectors. This development follows a significant increase in India's exports to Australia, which grew by 8% in 2024-25, underscoring the success of the India-Australia Economic Cooperation & Trade Agreement (ECTA).

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?

So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.

items.summary: U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures fell 20 cents, or 0.5%, to $37.85 a barrel at 0056 GMT, after climbing 3.5% on Wednesday.

items.title: US EIA cuts 2020 world oil demand growth forecast
items.summary: In its monthly forecast, the agency cut its oil demand growth estimate for 2021 by 490,000 bpd to 6.53 million bpd.

items.title: Gold may remain choppy, but buying may emerge at lower levels: Kotak Securities
items.summary: Gold may remain choppy but buying may emerge at lower levels amid increasing global uncertainty and also as Fed’s dovish stance may limit upside in US dollar.

items.title: Oil breaks below $40/bbl on demand concerns, improving supply
items.summary: Fed#39;s dovish stance may also limit any major upside in the US dollar.

items.title: Agri Picks Report: Geojit
items.summary: According to Geojit, Global consumption of edible oils is expected to fall 30-40% in 2020 because of coronavirus lockdowns, said Dominic Xavier, Middle East and North Africa region head at Sime Darby Oils.

items.title: Oil falls further amid growing alarm over coronavirus second wave
items.summary: The biggest global health crisis in a century continues to flare unabated with cases rising in India, Great Britain, Spain and several parts of the United States, where the infection rate has not come under control for months.

items.title: Gold flat as dollar strength counters safe-haven demand
items.summary: Spot gold was little changed at $1,929.30 per ounce by 0038 GMT, after falling to a near two-week week low of $1,906.24 on Tuesday.

items.title: Gold may witness choppy trade, expect buying at lower levels: Kotak Securities
items.summary: After weeks of consolidation, crude oil has come under pressure amid signs of correction in US equity market and gains in US dollar index.

items.title: Energy Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Oil prices hit a rough patch last week, falling back in line with broader financial markets. Prices did try to inch higher, but experienced selling pressure at highs.

items.title: Precious Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Gold fell to the lowest level in a month primarily as the dollar rose against its major crosses and better-than-expected economic number from the US.

items.title: Base Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Base metals traded choppy last week, with prices hitting multi month highs at the start of the week and followed by some profit taking on back of volatility in the dollar and mixed data signals from China and US.

items.title: Uncle Sam is wrong, India and China are doing their bit to fight climate change
items.summary: It is true that there is an increase in carbon emission by India and China due to homegrown consumption and lack of infrastructure. But let#39;s keep in mind that India#39;s carbon emissions per capita are still 10 times lower and China#39;s is half of that compared to the US.
